intro: Elaeocarpus polycarpus, commonly known as the many-fruited elaeocarpus, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or purple when mature, containing one or two seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
